metadata.title: CVE-2019-11815 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in rds_tcp_kill_sock in net/rds/tcp.c in the Linuxkernel before 5.0.8. There is a race condition leading to a use-after-free,related to net namespace cleanup.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11815` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-150-generic - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-4.4.0-150-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-4.4.0-150-lowlatency - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-4.4.0-150-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-4.4.0-150-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-4.4.0-150-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-4.4.0-150-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-150-generic - 4.4.0-150.176
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-150-lowlatency - 4.4.0-150.176
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1110.118
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1114-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1114.119
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1084-aws - 4.4.0-1084.94
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-55-generic - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-4.15.0-55-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-4.15.0-55-lowlatency - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-55-generic - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-55-lowlatency - 4.15.0-55.60~16.04.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1051-azure - 4.15.0-1051.56
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1037-gcp - 4.15.0-1037.39~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1047-kvm - 4.4.0-1047.53
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1018-oracle - 4.15.0-1018.20~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1011-fips - 4.4.0-1011.14
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1011-fips - 4.4.0-1011.14

linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.4.0-1011-fips - 4.4.0-1011.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-150.176').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1037.39~16.04.1').
